intro: Askellia naniformis, commonly known as the dwarf askellia, is a small, flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, rounded leaves and clusters of delicate, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
